meanings.definition: To outwit or outsmart someone in a psychological manner.
meanings.sent1: She managed to outpsych her opponent by predicting his next move.
meanings.sent2: He always tries to outpsych his classmates during mind games.
meanings.sent3: The detective decided to outpsych the criminal by setting up a clever trap.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to outpsych others made her a formidable opponent in the game of wits.
meanings.sent5: In order to outpsych the tricky riddle, she had to think several steps ahead.

meanings.definition: To surpass or outperform someone in a psychological competition.
meanings.sent1: The team was able to outpsych their rivals by staying calm under pressure.
meanings.sent2: He always aims to outpsych his opponents by staying focused on his strategy.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to outpsych his audience by performing an unexpected trick.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to outpsych her competitors gave her an edge in the mental challenge.
meanings.sent5: To outpsych the competition, he needed to stay one step ahead in his tactics.
